title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O)
OB: When invoking the 'New Java Package' in the wizard, a message appears at the top that says 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists', even when the package name field is empty. The user is unsure about what this message means and whether it is an error. The user also suggests that if it is an error, it should be displayed in red with the error icon.
EB: When invoking the 'New Java Package' in the wizard, the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' should not appear when the package name field is empty. If the message is necessary, it should be clarified to provide a more meaningful explanation. Additionally, if the message indicates an error, it should be displayed in red with the error icon.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the 'New Java Package' wizard.
2. Leave the package name field empty.
3. Observe the message that appears at the top of the wizard.
